title: Customer Loyalty Dynamics in Quick-Service Retail: A Time Series Analysis
abstract: This study examines customer loyalty patterns in quick-service retail environments. Using 18 months of transaction data from 3,200 customers, we find that loyalty program members visit 2.3x more frequently and have 34% higher lifetime value. Mobile app usage correlates strongly with retention (r=0.67, p<0.001).
key_findings: Loyalty members visit 2.3x more frequently than non-members
Mobile app usage increases retention by 34%
Morning customers have 12% higher satisfaction scores
Wait times above 7 minutes correlate with 22% drop in return visits
methods: Longitudinal analysis, regression modeling, customer segmentation
